w:r.w:t: 处可导，以下说法中错误的是（
处可导，以下说法中错误的是（
君子博学而日参省乎己
阅读下面短文，掌握其大意，然后从
各题所给的四个选项（A、B、C和D）中，选出最佳选项。
The day before Christmas I pulled into a store parking lot and counted my money again.
being poor, not having enough to
my small children a few simple toys. As I was
I noticed the Salvation Army(救世军) bell ringer（敲钟人） at the
. I felt bad again because I didn’t feel I could
anything to give him. I started walking towards the entrance
two cars entered empty parking spaces in front of me. The first was a_
of me the moment I saw it. “How
,”I thought, “would it be to have enough money to buy a car like that!” The second car,
, was an ancient car more shabby than the one I was driving.
A man got out of the Cadillac and hurried into the store
past the bell ringer without a second
.Out of the old car came a young mother with three small children following_
as her car, yet she stopped at the entrance and
a bill. In that second a(n)
touched me, my envy and dislike__
me, and all the love and joy filled me. I fished a bill out of my own purse,
it in the Salvation Army kettle, and wished the
Now I felt I was a poor man but rich on the
. After finding a few things for my kids, I drove home with my heart singing.
A. smile B. nod C. glance
试题分析：本文讲了我在去商店购物的时候，在商店入口看到的一幕对我震撼很大，使得我不再因贫穷而感到憎恶，而感到内心是富有的。
A 考查动词以及对语境的理解。A. hate讨厌；B. Permitted允许；C. escaped逃跑； D. regretted后悔。这里的意思是：我讨厌贫穷。故选A。
B 考查动词以及对语境的理解。A. make使得； B. Buy 买； C. Award奖励； D. lend借。这里的意思是：没有足够的钱给我的孩子买一些简单的礼物。故选B。
C 考查动词短语以及对语境的理解。A. pulling out拉出； B. settling in定居；C. getting out出来；D. cutting in切掉。这里指的是我从商店停车场出来。故选C。
D 考查名词以及对语境的理解。At the entrance在……入口。这里指的是从商店的停车场出来去往商店的入口。故选D。
A 考查动词以及对语境的理解。A. Spare分享；B. Split分离；C. Spend花费；D. Save挽救。这里的意思是：我不能给他任何东西。故选A。
C考查连词以及对语境的理解。A. though 尽管；B. Since因为；C. When当；D. if如果。这里的意思是：我开始朝商店的入口走，这时有两辆车停在了我前面的空车位。这里表示同时发生。故选C。
D考查形容词以及对语境的理解。A. sharp尖锐的；B. Dull迟钝的；C. Pure纯洁的；D. Shiny闪亮的。由后文的凯迪拉克可知，这里应该是耀眼的。故选D。
B 考查名词以及对语境的理解。A. target 目标； B. envy 嫉妒，羡慕；C. item东西，物品； D. Bargain讲价。这里的意思是：我看到第一眼是就很羡慕。故选B。
A 考查形容词以及对语境的理解。A. nice 好的； B. precious 珍贵的；C. rare 稀有的；D. expensive 昂贵的。这里的意思是：如果有钱买一辆这样的车该多好。故选A。
B 考查连词以及对语境的理解。A. therefore因此；B. however然而； C. anyhow不管怎样； D. besides 另外。这里的意思是：然而第二辆车比我开的车还要破旧，古老。这里前后是转折关系。故选B。
B 考查副词以及对语境的理解。A. merely 仅仅；B. Right正好；C. hopefully希望地；D. Seldom很少。一个从凯迪拉克出来的人匆忙的正巧从敲钟人身边走过。故选：B.
C考查名词以及对语境的理解。A. smile微笑；B. nod点头；C. glance 撇一眼；D. Wave摆动。这里指的是；都没有撇一眼，表示没有看一下敲钟老人。故选C。
D考查副词以及对语境的理解。A. firmly坚定地；B. bravely勇敢地；C. casually偶然地；D. Closely紧紧的。这里的意思是：从破旧的车上下来的年轻妇女带着三个孩子，三个孩子紧跟在她后面。故选D。
A考查动词短语以及对语境的理解。A. worn out 穿破的；B. cast down扔掉；C. tired out 精疲力尽；D. broken down抛锚。这里的意思是：她的衣服和她的鞋子一样破旧。故选A。
C考查动词以及对语境的理解。A. paid支付；B. passed传递；C. donated 贡献； D. Rejected拒绝。这里的意思是：他停在了入口，付了钱。故选C。
D考查名词以及对语境的理解。A. equality平等；B. sympathy 同情；C. approval 支持； D. Warmth温暖。这里的意思是：就在那一刻，我感觉到了温暖。故选D。
A考查动词以及对语境的理解。A. left离开；B. visited 参观；C. reached 到达； D. missed。错过。这里的意思是：我没有了羡慕和讨厌，而是充满了爱。故选A。
D考查动词比较级以及对语境的理解。A. took 拿；B. handed传递；C. started 开始； D. Dropped放在。这里的意思是：我从钱包里拿出了钱，放在了他的盒子里。故选D。
B考查代词以及对语境的理解。这里是嘱咐敲钟人圣诞快乐。故选B。
C考查名词以及对语境的理解。A. wealth 富有； B. luck运气；C. Inside内心；D. Outside外面。这里的意思是：现在我感觉虽然贫穷，但是内心富有。故选C。
考点：考查人生感悟类阅读。

Now scientists believe that global warming affects hibernating(冬眠的) animals, causing them to wake up earlier. While this may seem a little concern, it is in fact a significant environmental problem. The shortened hibernation (冬眠)period could actually lead to significant declines in the populations of several species.

Some of the first concrete evidence of the phenomenon came from Colorado, where researchers at the Rocky Mountain Biological lab have been observing marmot（旱獭）hibernation behavior since the 1970s. In the early days of their studies, marmots generally hibernated several weeks into the month of May. Nowadays, however, temperatures in the area have risen by 2.5 degrees Fahrenheit(华氏度), and the marmots are waking up about a month earlier.
At least the marmots are still hibernating. Several other animals have not been

hibernating at all recently. Brown bears in the Spanish Cantabrian Mountains did not hibernate last year. In parts of the United States, chipmunks （花鼠）also skipped the hibernation period. The bears seem to have survived without losing many individuals. The chipmunks, however, were not so lucky. Many of the animals died of starvation during the winter.

The problem with animals waking up early, or skipping hibernation altogether, lies with the creatures’ metabolism（新陈代谢）. When an animal hibernates, their metabolism drops significantly. The animals’ heart rate slows, and they require very little energy to live. When the animals awake from their winter slumber, their metabolism returns to normal.

But while their metabolism may be as active as it was before hibernation, food sources aren’t as available as they were before. A marmot may wake up when temperatures get warmer, thinking it’s spring, but plants will not have gotten the amount of sun they need to signal their spring period of growth. So until the plants grow, the marmots have no reliable food source.

Many scientists believe the problem will continue to get worse. In addition to changes in hibernation patterns, some believe that other animals will also begin to change their migration patterns or begin to give birth earlier. For many biologists, that’s a scary prospect. Terry Root, an animal expert at Stanford University, said: “I do think what we will be facing is the extinction of many species."
1、What is the viewpoint of the writer?
A. Global warming will continue to get worse as time goes on.
B. Global warming will lead to shortened hibernation of some animals.
C. Shortened hibernation will result in declines in the population of animals.
D. Some animals will skip hibernation altogether.
2、The writer sets the example of the marmot so as to __________.
A. explain that global warming influences animals’ hibernation
B. indicate that the weather gets warmer and warmer now
C. show that the weather in the United States is quite different
D. say some animals do not hibernate now due to warm weather
3、Why can’t marmots find enough food when they wake up?
A. Because there are too many marmots in the wild now.
B. Because plants haven’t received enough sunlight for spring growth.
C. Because winter days end much earlier than before.
D. Because more and more animal species skip hibernation now.
4、Terry Root holds a(n) __________ attitude towards the future of animals.
试题分析: 本文主要讲了全球变暖使得冬眠的动物冬眠的时间减少，这会使得他们的数量减少，物种减少。
C 细节理解题。根据文中The shortened hibernation (冬眠)period could actually lead to significant declines in the populations of several species.可知，作者认为冬眠期的减少将会导致物种数量的减少。故选B。

A细节理解题。根据文中Some of the first concrete evidence of the phenomenon came from Colorado, where researchers at the Rocky Mountain Biological lab have been observing marmot（旱獭）hibernation behavior since the 1970s.可知，作者列出早獭的例子是想解释全球变暖对动物冬眠的影响。所以选A。

B细节理解题。根据文中A marmot may wake up when temperatures get warmer, thinking it’s spring, but plants will not have gotten the amount of sun they need to signal their spring period of growth. So until the plants grow, the marmots have no reliable food source.他们找不到食物的原因是春天还没有到来，植物还没有长成。所以选B。
C 细节理解题。根据文中Terry Root, an animal expert at Stanford University, said: “I do think what we will be facing is the extinction of many species."，可知，Terry认为人们将面临许多物种的灭绝。所以选C。
考点：考查环境类短文阅读。
